Da bi dobro slišali
Znaki, ki kažejo na to, da je z našim sluhom nekaj narobe, so različni, najpogosteje opazimo, da se težko sporazumevamo v okoljih, kjer je več hrupa.
05 Nov 2019, 20:50 by M. M. K.



GETTY IMAGES/ISTOCKPHOTOČe ne slišimo več dobro, povejmo zdravniku, napotil nas bo na nadaljnje preiskave.



GETTY IMAGES/ISTOCKPHOTONaše uho ni prilagojeno za industrijski hrup in poslušanje preglasne glasbe prek slušalk. FOTOGRAFIJE: Guliver/Getty Images



GETTY IMAGESKako dobro pa vi slišite?


V vsakodnevnem življenju je sluh zelo pomembno čutilo, vsekakor pa se premalo zavedamo, kako hitro ga lahko izgubimo, opozarjajo strokovnjaki. S staranjem, še bolj pa s hrupom, ki je vse okoli nas, se slabša.


Če ne slišimo več dobro, povejmo zdravniku, napotil nas bo na nadaljnje preiskave.GETTY IMAGES/ISTOCKPHOTO

Popolno izgubo ali hudo izgubo sluha lahko kaj hitro prepoznamo in ukrepamo, večje težave nastanejo pri manjših poškodbah oziroma okvarah, ki jih sami ne prepoznamo, oziroma na znake, ki bi kazali na to, da je z njim kaj narobe, nismo pozorni. Takšne okvare lahko zelo okrnijo kakovost našega življenja in precej otežijo vsakdan.Otorinolaringologi oziroma otologi, specialisti za sluh, povedo, da težave pri postopnem izgubljanju sluha nastanejo v notranjem delu ušesa, ki ga poleg ravnotežnostnega dela tvori polžek. To je najpomembnejši del ušesa, saj valovanje spremeni v električne impulze; ti se nato po slušnem živcu prek nevronskih oziroma živčnih poti prevedejo do možganske skorje, kjer nastane zaznava zvoka.


Naše uho ni prilagojeno za industrijski hrup in poslušanje preglasne glasbe prek slušalk. FOTOGRAFIJE: Guliver/Getty ImagesGETTY IMAGES/ISTOCKPHOTO

Težava nastane, ko začnejo propadati senzorične oziroma čutne celice. Do okvare sluha oziroma naglušnosti najpogosteje pride pri zelo visokih frekvencah.Težava je predvsem v tem, da se čutne celice niso sposobne samoobnavljati oziroma regenerirati, in ko se okvarijo, to pomeni večinoma trajno izgubo sluha.
Znaki izgube sluha
Znaki, ki kažejo na to, da je z našim sluhom nekaj narobe, se kažejo na različne načine. Najpogosteje opazimo, da se težko sporazumevamo v okoljih, kjer je več hrupa, denimo v gostilni, kavarni, pisarni, kjer je več ljudi in se pogovarjajo oziroma več ljudi istočasno govori.Na okvaro kaže tudi potreba, da izgovorjeno še enkrat ali večkrat ponovimo in da se zdi, da vse več ljudi govori nerazumljivo oziroma momljajo nekaj sebi v brado in govorijo tako, da jih je težko razumeti. Tudi težje spremljanje televizije ali radijskih programov, ne da bi zvišali ton, kaže na to, da ni vse v najboljšem redu. Precej pogosta znaka izgubljanja sluha oziroma naglušnosti sta, da nam šumi v enem ali obeh ušesih in da moramo pri pogovarjanju s kom brati z njegovih ustnic, da ga razumemo.Vsakršno slabšanje sluha lahko hitro privede do številnih drugih težav, za katere seveda ne vemo, da je vzrok prav to. Stanje lahko pripelje do vznemirjenosti, živčnosti, tudi tega, da se začnemo izogibati pogovorom oziroma druženju z drugimi, lahko se celo povsem umaknemo iz socialnega okolja, to pa nemalokrat za sabo potegne še številne druge težave, ki sčasoma lahko vodijo do resnejših bolezni, denimo depresije.


Kako dobro pa vi slišite?GETTY IMAGES

Otorinolaringologi zato opozarjajo, da smo na svoj sluh pozorni ter da takoj, ko opazimo katerega od navedenih znakov, naredimo preizkus, kako dobro sploh slišimo. Najbolje je, da o tem spregovorimo z osebnim zdravnikom, da nas bo po potrebi napotil na nadaljnje preiskave.
Preventiva
Pri okvari sluha si lahko pomagamo s slušnimi aparati, ki so že tako tehnološko napredni in prijazni do uporabnika, da jih lahko vsakdo brez težav uporablja, poleg tega se lahko prilagodimo določenim situacijam, v katerih pričakujemo oteženo sporazumevanje. Vsekakor razloga, da bi zaradi naglušnosti ostajali doma oziroma se povsem izolirali od okolja, ni.Najbolje seveda je, da delujemo preventivno, torej sluh zaščitimo pred hrupom oziroma se izogibamo prostorom in situacijam, kjer je preglasno.
Premalo se zavedamo, kako hitro lahko sluh izgubimo.
Vedeti moramo, da človeško uho ni prilagojeno za industrijski hrup, za poslušanje preglasne glasbe prek slušalk, ko jakost brez težav preseže 100 dB, previdni moramo biti na koncertih ali športnih prireditvah. Zdravniki pravijo, da je treba poskrbeti, da znova slišimo – ne glede na to, kaj povzroči izgubo sluha. In danes je možnosti za to res veliko.

To hear well
Signs that indicate that something is wrong with our hearing are different, most often we notice that it is difficult to communicate in environments where there is more noise.
05 Nov 2019, 20:50 by M. M. K.



GETTY IMAGES / ISTOCKPHOTOIf we no longer hear well, tell your doctor, he will refer us for further investigation.



GETTY IMAGES / ISTOCKPHOTONYour ear is not tuned for industrial noise and listening to loud music through headphones. PHOTOS: Gulliver / Getty Images



GETTY IMAGESHow good are you hearing?


Hearing is a very important sensation in everyday life, but we are too little aware of how quickly we can lose it, experts warn. With aging, and even more so with the noise that is all around us, it gets worse.


If we no longer hear well, tell your doctor he will refer us for further investigation.GETTY IMAGES / ISTOCKPHOTO

Complete loss or severe hearing loss can be quickly recognized and corrected, major problems occur with minor injuries or impairments that we do not recognize ourselves, or with signs that indicate that something is wrong with him or her, we do not pay attention. Such impairments can greatly impair the quality of our lives and make our everyday life much more difficult. This is the most important part of the ear as it turns the wave into electrical impulses; these are then transmitted through the auditory nerve via neural or nerve pathways to the cerebral cortex, where sound perception is generated.


Our ear is not adapted for industrial noise and listening to loud music through headphones. PHOTOS: Gulliver / Getty ImagesGETTY IMAGES / ISTOCKPHOTO

The problem arises when sensory or sensory cells begin to decay. Hearing impairment or hearing loss is most commonly occurring at very high frequencies. The problem is, above all, that the sensory cells are not able to self-renew or regenerate, and when they are impaired, this means mostly permanent hearing loss.
Signs of hearing loss
Signs that indicate that something is wrong with our hearing are shown in different ways. Most often, we find it difficult to communicate in environments where there is more noise, such as an inn, a cafe, an office where there are more people talking or talking at the same time. The impairment is also indicated by the need to repeat one or more times, and that more and more people seem to be misunderstanding, or beating something in their beards and talking in a way that is difficult to understand. Even more difficult to monitor television or radio programs without raising the tone indicates that not everything is at its best. Quite common signs of hearing loss or hearing loss are that it sounds in one or both ears, and that when we talk to anyone, we need to read it to understand it. that the cause is just that. The situation can lead to anxiety, nervousness, even avoiding conversations or socializing with others, and even withdrawing completely from the social environment, which often raises many other problems that can lead to more serious illnesses over time, such as depression.


How good do you hear it? GETTY IMAGES

Otorhinolaryngologists therefore point out that we are attentive to our hearing and that as soon as we see any of these signs, we test how well we hear. It is best to discuss this with your GP so that he or she may refer us for further investigation if necessary.
Prevention
Hearing impairments can be assisted by hearing aids that are already so technologically advanced and user-friendly that anyone can easily use them, and we can adapt to certain situations where we expect difficult communication. Certainly there is no reason to stay home or be completely isolated from the environment because of the deafness. The best thing, of course, is that we act preventively, that is, to protect our hearing from noise, or to avoid places and situations where it is too loud.
We are too little aware of how quickly hearing can be lost.
We need to know that the human ear is not adapted for industrial noise, for listening to loud music through headphones, when the volume easily exceeds 100 dB, we must be careful at concerts or sports events. Doctors say we need to make sure we hear again - no matter what causes the hearing loss. And today, there are really many options for this.
